meanings.sent1: The plain white wall was indistinctive among the colorful paintings.
meanings.sent2: Her indistinctive features made it hard to pick her out of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon's indistinctive color helped it hide from predators.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of faces, his indistinctive appearance faded into the background.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctive sound of the distant train whistle echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The blurry photo made the faces indistinctive.
meanings.sent2: The handwriting was so messy that it became indistinctive.
meanings.sent3: The indistinctive shapes in the fog looked like mysterious creatures.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day were becoming indistinctive, fading away.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctive outline of the figure in the dark alley sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.sent1: The camouflage jacket was indistinctive in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bird's feathers were indistinctive against the tree bark.
meanings.sent3: The spy's indistinctive attire helped him go unnoticed in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her indistinctive scent masked her presence from the hunting dogs.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctive pattern on the butterfly's wings made it almost invisible among the flowers.
